intro: Crepidomanes acutum, commonly known as the sharp-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, it thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The plant's flowers are typically pink or purple, and it produces small, dry fruits known as capsules. Due to its hardy nature, it is often used in xeriscaping and as a ground cover in dry landscapes.
